titleStmt.title: The shepherd's son: or, The faithless nurse. Containing a royal frolick between King Edward the Fourth, and his nobles, at Westminster; as you shall find in this following ditty, taken from ancient writings, for the satisfaction of the world. To the tune of, The royal forrester. Licens'd according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Bates, at the Sun and Bible, in Pye-corner,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Date of publication suggested by the National Library of Scotland: [1690 or later].
First line: I come not to sing you a sonnet of lies.
Printed in black letter in four columns.
